-- A 47 - year - old woman pleaded guilty to sending letters to Senators Marco Rubio and Bill Nelson in June of 2011 , threatening their lives .
-- A 47 - year - old woman pleaded guilty to sending letters to Senators Marco Rubio and Bill Nelson in June of 2011 , threatening their lives .
Kathryn Cohen Allen , of Jasper , faces a maximum penalty of ten years in federal prison and a fine of $ 500,000 .
Allen allegedly mailed threatening letters containing a white powdery substance to the offices of United States Senators Marco Rubio and Bill Nelson , according to court documents .
Allen allegedly mailed threatening letters containing a white powdery substance to the offices of United States Senators Marco Rubio and Bill Nelson , according to court documents .
Testing of the substance revealed it was not hazardous .
Allen allegedly admitted that sending the letters in attempt to frame a neighbor she believed was in an interracial relationship .
